title: Quiz 8: DHMT & Health Sector Reforms
description: Test your understanding of the District Health Management Team and the National Priority Health Packages.

questions.question: Which of the following are **CORE** members of the DHMT? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The DMOH, DPHN, and Matron are core. The Nutritionist is typically a co-opted member.

questions.question: Who serves as the Chairman of the DHMT?
Match the health package to its priority level (High vs Low):
questions.explanation: High priority targets major killers (Malaria, HIV). Low priority targets non-fatal conditions (Eye/Skin).

questions.question: The District Public Health Nurse (DPHN) is responsible for the procurement, storage, and distribution of ___BLANK___ vaccines.
questions.explanation: The DPHN manages EPI (Expanded Programme on Immunization) vaccines.
questions.hint: The acronym for the immunization program.

questions.question: Which document outlined strategies for health service management in 1999?
questions.explanation: The KHPFP (1999) outlined the reform strategies.

questions.question: Non-communicable diseases (diabetes, cardiovascular) are classified as High Priority Health Packages.
questions.explanation: They are classified as **Medium Priority** Health Packages.
questions.hint: High priority usually involves infectious killers.

questions.question: What are the functions of the DHMT? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Supervising all health activities in the district

questions.explanation: DHMT formulates *district* objectives, not national policies. Supervision, training, and licensing are key functions.
questions.hint: Think District level actions, not National.

questions.question: Which health package includes the control of cholera, typhoid, and dysentery?
questions.explanation: Control of major environmental health communicable diseases (Cholera, etc.) is a High Priority Package.
questions.hint: Is it High, Medium, or Low?

questions.question: Who is responsible for deploying nursing staff to community/rural health facilities?
questions.explanation: The DPHN deploys nursing staff to rural facilities.

questions.question: The National Health Sector Strategic Plan (NHSSP) aimed to increase the regulatory role of the government.
questions.explanation: One objective was to enhance the regulatory role of the government.
